content:
I updated my position document. Thanks to all who commented, or who participated in discussions otherwise.

I fixed a bunch of things / improved terminology, and clarified that MVP CHERI should be strict-provenance only. I still think there's value for some polyfills for ptr.expose_addr() and std::ptr::from_exposed that work on Rust-allocated pointers, so I've improved and worked them out in more detail and I explain why it's still better than x64. (No more double pointers.)

If you have thoughts, feel free to write them here or on HackMD, but it seems HackMD messes up the comment locations sometimes.
